metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10188 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
utility.c in telnetd in netkit telnet through 0.17 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via short writes or urgent data, because of a buffer overflow involving the netclear and nextitem functions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-10188` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

inetutils-ftp - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1
inetutils-ftpd - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1
inetutils-inetd - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1
inetutils-ping - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1
inetutils-syslogd - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1
inetutils-talk - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1
inetutils-talkd - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1
inetutils-telnet - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1
inetutils-telnetd - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1
inetutils-tools - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1
inetutils-traceroute - 2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

telnet - 0.17-41.2build1
telnetd - 0.17-41.2build1
No subscription required

notes.Note: ccdm94> in netkit-telnet, this CVE was patched in 0.17-18woody2. See https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=953477 for more information.

criterions.comment: inetutils package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.9.4-11ubuntu0.1').
netkit-telnet package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.17-41.2build1').
netkit-telnet-ssl package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
